Package io.github.ai4ci.abm

Class ModelUpdate

java.lang.Object
io.github.ai4ci.abm.ModelUpdate
public class ModelUpdate extends Object
Collection of pre-packaged model update functions (hooks) that are applied during the simulation update cycle. These are intended to be small, reusable processing units that can be combined by the Updater to produce the final per-day changes to both OutbreakState and PersonState.

Where these are used in the update cycle:

  • The Updater builds a list of outbreak and person processors from the values declared in the enums below. Those processors are applied in the updateState phase of the update cycle (see Updater.updateState(Outbreak)).
  • Order and timing: outbreak processors are applied as pre- and post-processors around the per-agent updates (see Updater.updateState(Outbreak)), while person processors run for each agent during the agent-level updateState (see Updater.updateState(Person)). The Updater constructor collects the enum values into the processor lists so adding a new enum value automatically exposes it to the update loop.
  • These functions execute after behaviour and policy state transitions have been determined for the upcoming day. That means they can see the new behaviour/policy choices (the state machine will already have computed the next behaviour/policy), but they execute while the rest of the model (states/histories) is still in the transitional phase described in Updater's class-level documentation.

Design notes and extension points:

  • Each enum value below wraps a ModelOperation.OutbreakStateUpdater or ModelOperation.PersonStateUpdater â€” small lambdas that accept a selector and a mutator/consumer. Use ModelOperation.updatePersonState(java.util.function.Predicate, ModelOperation.TriConsumer) and ModelOperation.updateOutbreakState(java.util.function.Predicate, ModelOperation.TriConsumer) to create new updaters in the same style.
  • Person processors run after in-host and risk models have been advanced to (t+1) but before the newly built state is committed to the agent. This allows processors to observe computed infection/risk signals and modify the next state builder accordingly (e.g., set immunisation dose, schedule importation exposures, or set other next-day modifiers).
  • Because these updaters are invoked late in the state construction phase, they should avoid mutating long-lived shared structures; prefer modifying the provided builders.

Work-in-progress / Vaccination note:

  • The ModelUpdate.PersonUpdaterFn.IMMUNISATION_PROTOCOL is provided as a placeholder to show where vaccination/immunisation logic can be implemented. The current implementation merely sets immunisationDose to 0 on the next builder and should be considered incomplete. Full vaccination routines (eligibility, prioritisation, multi-dose scheduling, waning immunity, and interaction with the in-host model) are not yet implemented in this helper and should be authored either as a new person processor (via Updater.withPersonProcessor(java.util.function.Predicate<io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person>, io.github.ai4ci.flow.mechanics.ModelOperation.TriConsumer<io.github.ai4ci.abm.ImmutablePersonState.Builder, io.github.ai4ci.abm.Person, io.github.ai4ci.util.Sampler>)) or by extending this enum with a complete implementation that consults the outbreak's ExecutionConfiguration and the agent's demographic/state.

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    ModelUpdate.OutbreakUpdaterFn
    Outbreak-level updaters: run once per day during the updateState phase (see Updater.updateState(Outbreak)).
    static enum 
    ModelUpdate.PersonUpdaterFn
    Person-level updaters: run for every person during the updateState phase (see Updater.updateState(Person)).
